title: The Forgiveness Ledger
outcome: An encrypted digital ledger, created by Halden, is uncovered, documenting secret acts of mercy and resistance by BCI enforcers. Its public release divides Stenograd, sparking widespread debate about justice, forgiveness, and complicity. This forces key figures and everyday citizens alike to face difficult truths about their roles and choices during the BCI regime, sending shockwaves through social, political, and reconciliation processes.

events.description: The encrypted 'Forgiveness Ledger' is decrypted and published. It reveals names of BCI enforcers who showed secret mercy or resistance. Citywide conversation erupts over whether these actions erase guilt or deepen it.
Survivors and enforcers hold face-to-face meetings in local assemblies, testimonies range from tearful apologies to outraged calls for accountability. Tensions flare in certain districts.
The Council debates creating a formal Truth and Forgiveness Tribunal. Directorate loyalists denounce the process, while Innovators and Harmonists support it as the only path toward lasting peace.
Public forums broadcast difficult reunions of families and former enforcers. Forgiveness is granted in some cases, rejected in others. The city experiences both powerful healing and sharp divides.

The Council narrowly passes the formation of the Tribunal, tasking it with mediating amnesty, reconciliation, and accountability cases, making the Forgiveness Ledger central to Stenograd’s new justice process.
